TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

In DATE , as a result of the GPE nuclear plant disaster , the applicant and her family had to move from GPE , which is situated QUANTITY from GPE ( a so - called “ third zone of radioactive pollution ” ) . The applicant settled in GPE , the LOC . The applicant 's apartment in GPE ( which she had leased from the ORG ) is currently occupied by her son 's family

In DATE ORG provided the applicant with an apartment in a co - operative house . The applicant paid part of the price . The applicant alleges that the apartment was in an unfit state and that she had to spend money to have it repaired .
On DATE the applicant applied to ORG for the reimbursement of the expenses incurred in acquiring the apartment , to which she was entitled as a victim of the GPE disaster .

By DATE the applicant had received , in CARDINAL instalments , a total of ORG CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) by way of reimbursement of the cost of purchasing the apartment . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG , alleging that the sum received did not cover the amount that she had had to spend on the repair of the apartment and took no account of the effects of inflation .

On DATE the ORG of PERSON rejected the applicant 's claim . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment . The court stated , inter alia , that the case was not a civil but a public law dispute . Therefore , the sum to be reimbursed could not be based on the actual expenses and losses of the applicant but had to be determined by the local authorities on the basis of the PERSON of DATE ( see the “ Relevant law ” below ) and relevant governmental regulations . The court further indicated that , in the applicant 's case , the amount of the reimbursement had been determined by ORG on the basis of the method established by ORG in accordance with the DATE PERSON . The sum was calculated with reference to the value of the apartment on the date of purchase , the time of the payment of the reimbursement and other criteria . Since the applicant 's costs had been reimbursed in full , the applicant had no right under domestic legislation to receive any further sum from the ORG .

According to ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Law “ On ORG ” of CARDINAL DATE ( “ the DATE LAW ) , the zones of radioactive pollution are determined depending on their level of pollution . Persons living in the third zone of radioactive pollution are entitled to “ guaranteed voluntary resettlement ” . This means that the citizens who live in this zone are entitled to receive objective information about the level of pollution , sufficient to enable them to decide whether to continue living in this territory . If they decide to leave the area , then the authorities are obliged to create the necessary conditions for resettlement .

Article QUANTITY of the PERSON provides that persons who moved from the third zone of radioactive pollution are entitled to receive free housing with CARDINAL options to apply for it . First , they can apply to the local authorities to obtain free municipal housing . In this case :
“ [ the persons ] are put by the organisations they work in or by executive committees of the local councils on a separate waiting list for attribution of municipal housing on the priority basis ”

“ the executive committee of the local council , the citizens ' employer as well as the citizens themselves can buy ... homes and apartments from private persons for a market price ... as well as vacant public homes or apartments for residual value ”

In case if persons resettling from the GPE zone opt for acquiring the housing on their own ( either by buying or building it ) they are entitled to have their costs and expenses reimbursed to them by the ORG . The amount of and procedure for reimbursement are determined by the councils , based on the LAW and relevant governmental regulations .
